body: MARINE PARK, a neighborhood of 21,500 people in southeast Brooklyn, shares its name and a boundary with the borough's largest park, a 798-acre mass that stretches to the marshes of Jamaica Bay. Still, when Eugenia Klopsis, an emergency medical technician, met her future husband, a Marine Park resident named David Moskowitz, at the Flatlands
title: LIVING IN | MARINE PARK, BROOKLYN; Isolation Is Pretty Splendid

body: EVEN years ago, back when she rented in East Flatbush, Ismay Gardner knew she liked Canarsie, a quiet suburban community on Brooklyn's south shore with row upon row of detached houses and neat lawns. When she decided to buy a house, Canarsie was the first place she looked, and even when she moved -- twice -- it was within Canarsie. Now, Ms.
title: LIVING IN | CANARSIE, BROOKLYN; Homey, but No Haven From Hard Times

body: Trying to exploit the popularity of iPhones, four men used Craigslist to lure would-be buyers to Brooklyn and then robbed them at gunpoint, the police said on Thursday. The four men were arrested on Wednesday in Flatlands after officers set up a sting operation by responding to an advertisement on Craigslist, the police said. The men -- identified
title: Police: Robbers Used Craigslist
